iitp_6_python: Hough Lines Detection¶

The example project for implementing Hough transform for detecting lines.

Installation¶

To install the iitp_6_python project, run this command in your terminal:

$ pip install iitp_6_python

Usage¶

iitp_6_python’s usage looks like:

$ iitp_6_python [OPTIONS]
--version¶

Display the version and exit.

--help¶

Display a short usage message and exit.

Reference¶

  • iitp_6_python.console

  • iitp_6_python.hough_lines

iitp_6_python.console¶

Command-line interface.

iitp_6_python.hough_lines¶

Hough algorithm for detecting lines.

iitp_6_python.hough_lines.detect_and_draw_lines(image, angle_step=1, lines_are_white=True, value_threshold=5)¶

Detect lines in an image using Hough transform and draw them on the original image.

Parameters:

  • image (np.ndarray) – The input image.

  • angle_step (int) – Spacing between angles to use every n-th angle between -90 and 90 degrees. Default step is 1.

  • lines_are_white (bool) – Boolean indicating whether lines to be detected are white. Defaults to True.

  • value_threshold (int) – Pixel values above or below the value_threshold are edges. Defaults to 5.

Returns:

The original image with detected lines drawn on it.

Return type:

np.ndarray

Examples

>>> img = imageio.imread("./src/iitp_6_python/images/road.jpeg")
>>> result_image = detect_and_draw_lines(img)
>>> plt.imshow(result_image, cmap='gray')
>>> plt.axis('off')
>>> plt.show()
iitp_6_python.hough_lines.hough_line(img, angle_step=1, lines_are_white=True, value_threshold=5)¶

Hough transform for lines.

Parameters:

  • img (np.ndarray) – 2D binary image with nonzeros representing edges.

  • angle_step (int) – Spacing between angles to use every n-th angle between -90 and 90 degrees. Default step is 1.

  • lines_are_white (bool) – Boolean indicating whether lines to be detected are white. Defaults to True.

  • value_threshold (int) – Pixel values above or below the value_threshold are edges. Defaults to 5.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

accumulator (np.ndarray): 2D array of the hough transform accumulator. theta (np.ndarray): Array of angles used in computation, in radians. rhos (np.ndarray): Array of rho values. Max size is 2 times the diagonal

distance of the input image.

Return type:

tuple

Examples

>>> from iitp_6_python import hough_lines
>>> img = np.zeros((100, 100), dtype=np.uint8)
>>> img[25:75, 40:60] = 255
>>> accumulator, thetas, rhos = hough_lines.hough_line(img)
iitp_6_python.hough_lines.show_hough_line(img, accumulator, thetas, rhos, save_path='./')¶

Display the original image and its Hough transform.

Parameters:

  • img (np.ndarray) – Input image.

  • accumulator (np.ndarray) – Hough transform accumulator.

  • thetas (np.ndarray) – Array of angles used in computation, in radians.

  • rhos (np.ndarray) – Array of rho values. Max size is 2 times the diagonal distance of the input image.

  • save_path (str) – Path to save the figure. Defaults to None.

Return type:

None

Examples

>>> img = np.zeros((100, 100), dtype=np.uint8)
>>> img[25:75, 40:60] = 255
>>> accumulator, thetas, rhos = hough_line(img)
>>> show_hough_line(img, accumulator, thetas, rhos)
